page.title: 14 FARMING IN SAMPFORD cont'd
page.content: Rape is a crop that is being grown in larger amounts and by more farmers. This is a new popular crop which is replacing sugar beet in our area as a break crop.It is easy to spot by its bright yellow colour in spring and its dry smell in summer. Few acres are put down to oat.Because the area is not really suitable.Its a really difficult crop to harvest. Lots of farmers have stopped growing sugar beet in the last two years, because the local refinery at Felsted was closed down.Making the transport of the beet for refining was too expensive.The nearest refineries being at Bury-St-Edmunds and Ipswich. Large amounts of potatoes are grown.Most are sold from the farm gate.
